title: "Enter" don't execute search in Firefox
content:
There is still an issue with this - I have seen this function (pressing enter) not work in firefox for many many years.... can firefox be updated so pressing enter works?

jesperbobbel 8/4/23, 2:41â€¯PM

Today 05-08-2023 when useing Firefox, im no longer able to use enter key to execute a simple google search. But it works fine on Edge. I don't want to be forced to switch to Edge, how to i fix it?? it just happened randomly. More precisely it's the center of screen search-bar that don't work. I can still use the standard (top) search-bar

I have already tried to update it, close it, nothing works. And i would really like to not lose all my settings by uninstalling it.
creator: pushka

title: URL copying without tracking

creator: cleancoal.bob

title: No Longer Able to Print Emails (Gmail and AOL) or Save Them as PDF (works in other browsers; doesn't work in safemode either)
content:
I've never had this issue before, but as of this evening I am no longer able to Print Emails in Firefox. I can't print them to a physical printer nor save them as PDF. Once I select to print an email the "Preparing Preview" page loads, but then get stuck.

This happens even in Firefox Safe Mode.

This happens with any email client - happens with Gmail and with AOL email accounts.

I have no problems printing these same emails in Google Chrome browser.

In addition, if I follow Firefox's steps to "Clear saved print settings" the problem is solved for only a single printing before reverting to getting stuck again.

Any help is greatly appreciated. I have no idea how to get around this issue. I need to save multiple emails as PDF files and physically print them every day. This issue makes Firefox unusable to me.
creator: LK85

title: The 'Search' option has disappeared from the toolbar.  HELP!
content: The 'Search' option has disappeared from the toolbar. HELP!
creator: ski_gpsy

title: Opening Tabs By Itself
content: Honestly, I feel that this is more of a security question, but this is what happened: I had locked my laptop and walked away for a few hours. When I came back, Firefox had closed two of my tabs and opened three new ones, 2 of which were youtube videos that were playing music while my computer was locked. All of the tabs were centered around a gif that I looked up using a chat site's tenor keyboard and never actually sent. Why in the world did my locked laptop have a bunch of random tabs open? How do I stop this from happening in the future so I don't have to switch browsers? I did not like coming home to this at all. I ran a virus scan, but the only thing on my computer that was off was Firefox itself, so that's why I'm asking. This has never happened before, but I had to reinstall this browser a couple days ago so I'm wondering if there's some sort of bug or something that came with the new install. Please ease my mind about this.
creator: loseyourhands
